alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 8:17PM CST until February 28 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lincoln IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Henry affecting Marshall and Putnam Counties. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at Henry. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Water begins to affect the marina in Henry along with minor flooding of land adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 23.3 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Illinois River Henry 23.0 21.9 Wed 7 pm CST 22.7 23.2 23.3 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to prepare for flooding. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation.
